column4: hmm, I'm under the impression that Natty boots significantly slower then 10.10
also when shutting down, seems to take afes
I think it is likely due to hardware differences,,  is this a desktop or laptop?
laptop, 10.10 was lightning fast
not surprising,, even though most of the developers use laptops... 11.04  has exhibited different boot  speeds and glitches on several systems I have installed it on
give it about a month,,, most glitches should have been worked out by then,  although  ,, 10.04  was LTS,, and until 12.04,, I would consider every version inbetween,, experimental
true
if you are using 11.04  I can verify  that it has some video issues on dual monitors...
ah ok, yeah I'm on Natty
rather 11.04  Unity
yeah, I'm still trying to get used to it :)

at this point  Unity  on dual monitors ,, especially if you are enabling dual monitors after boot,, has issues,, there is quite a bit of video  garble in that situation,, so I am not surprise it does this while you boot to dual set up
I believe  it is related to  nux   which is an open-source java toolkit which was necessary , in part , for helping compiz to work on Unity
ah, I see
nux allows for " and efficient  XML pricessing"  unquote :)
rather  "an efficient"
I simply switched to classic gnome  ,,, much easier to deal with dual set ups..
yeah, think I might consider switching back as well
well  you dont have to swtich to a previous version...simply log off  and log onto classic :)
ah, yeah, that's what I meant :p
ph phew!  I thought you were going to downgrade :)
